page.title: 11FARMING IN ASHILL
page.content: Unlike the past, villages of today are not centred around farming. Modern machinery has meant that{less people {are employed,}and for more convenience fields have been made larger with the removal of hedges, woods etc, much to the annoyance of the environmentalists Improved plant breeding, liberal use of{chemicals and fertilizers}with advice from agronomists,has caused crop {yields to double}in the past decade,thus giving large surpluses, which have to be stored at great cost to the taxpayers. Although food today is of{very high quality,}many people are angered at the way in which some food is produced, eg:- eggs laid by battery chickens, and pigs, cattle & poultry fattened intensively.A farmers opinion:- "If industry & commerce had progressed as fast as farming the country would be far better off today"
